required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Fenestration Decompression Combined With Secondary Curettage for Ameloblastoma of the Jaw: Retrospective Radiographic Analysis
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Fenestration Decompression Combined With Secondary Curettage for Ameloblastoma of the Jaw: Retrospective Radiographic Analysis

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives: To investigate the outcomes of fenestration decompression combined with secondary curettage (FDSC) in the surgical treatment of jaw ameloblastoma.
Methods: Medical records of patients diagnosed as multicystic ameloblastoma (MA) or unicystic ameloblastoma (UA) by routine pathology were collected from January 2010 to December 2017 in Ninth People's Hospital, Shanghai JiaoTong University Medical College. Patients were divided into two groups based on the management regimen: FDSC group, and local curettage (LC) group. Patients were followed up for 3-8 years, using panoramic radiography to measure the change of the area of the cystic cavity involved in ameloblastoma and the recurrence or malignant transformation of the tumor in both groups. A total of 244 eligible patients were selected for provisional screening, including 145 patients with MA, and 99 patients with UA.

primary_outcome.description: (good effect case number + moderate effect case number)/total case number

secondary_outcome.description: the recurrence case number/total case number

other_outcome.description: malignant transformation case number/total case number

arm_group.arm_group_label: Fenestration decompression combined with secondary curettage (FDSC)
arm_group.description: Design of the opening window reasonably；Making cyst plug；secondary curettage
The tumor was removed by local curettage only

intervention.intervention_name: fenestration decompression combined with secondary curettage
intervention.description: First，fenestration decompression was performed. then, patients return every 3 months for follow up. If the cystic cavity area was gradually reduced after 12 months of follow-up, patients should be considered for secondary curettage surgery.
intervention.arm_group_label: Fenestration decompression combined with secondary curettage (FDSC)

study_pop.textblock: Medical records of patients diagnosed as multicystic ameloblastoma (MA) or unicystic ameloblastoma (UA) by routine pathology were collected from January 2010 to December 2017 in Ninth People's Hospital, Shanghai JiaoTong University Medical College. Patients were divided into two groups based on the management regimen: fenestration decompression combined with secondary curettage (FDSC) group, and local curettage (LC) group. Patients were followed up for 3-8 years, using panoramic radiography to measure the change of the area of the cystic cavity involved in ameloblastoma and the recurrence or malignant transformation of the tumor in both groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Medical records of patients who were diagnosed with multicystic ameloblastoma (MA) or unicystic ameloblastoma (UA) by routine pathology were collected from January 2010 to December 2017 in Ninth People's Hospital of Shanghai JiaoTong University Medical College.
Exclusion Criteria:
- followed up less than 3 years
- For FDSC group, fenestration decompression failed
- recurrent ameloblastoma
- received other type of surgery;

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University
